Title: Steganography using pixel value differencing and diamond encoding based on android
Source title: International Journal of Emerging Trends in Engineering Research
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Mathematics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Pratama, R.E., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia, Mathematics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rojali, Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Salman, A.G., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The PVD method in steganography used to embed secret message to image file by modifying pixel pair value. The addition of Diamond Encoding is to make difference of pixel pair dynamic so the difference in image’s pixel can’t be seen with naked eye. To make easier for user to choose and share image file, this application will be developed on Android smartphone. © 2020, World Academy of Research in Science and Engineering. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Android; Diamond Encoding; Difference in image’s pixel; PVD method
References: Yang, H.., Weng, C.Y., Wang, S.J., Sun, Adaptive Data Hiding in Edge Areas of Images With Spatial LSB Domain Systems (2008) IEEE Trans. Inf. Forensics Secur, 3 (3), pp. 488-497. , C.H [1]
Correspondence Address: Rojali; Computer Science Department, Indonesia; email: rojali@binus.ac.id
Publisher: World Academy of Research in Science and Engineering
Abbreviated Source Title: Int. J. Emerg. Trends Eng. Res.

Title: Steganography using android-based five pixel pair differencing and lsb substitution method
Source title: International Journal of Emerging Trends in Engineering Research
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Mathematics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Tanasal, A.H., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia, Mathematics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rojali, Mathematics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Salman, A., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: FPPD and LSB Substitution modified method are development of FPPD and LSB Substitution method. The modification of FPPD and LSB Substitution is located at the pixel block that is going to be used to insert the secret message. The pixel block being used is 2x2. The LSB Substitution method is a method to insert the data by changing the last bit of the pixel into the byte of the hidden message. FPPD uses data blocks and calculates the capacity of each blocks, then inserts the hidden message in accordance to the capacity of each blocks. The development of this method is expected to increase the capacity of the plain text without reducing the quality of the data produced. To help users in hiding and sending data, a steganoskrip application using improved PFFD and LSB Substitution method will be developed on Android smartphone. © 2020, World Academy of Research in Science and Engineering. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: FPPD method; Hidden message; LSB Substitution; Pixel
References: Dewi, A. A. I. K. G., Fajar, A. Authors: Rojali, Gaol F.L., Abdurahman E., Soewito B.
Title: A high quality steganography method with twenty five-pixel value differencing
Affiliations: Department of Mathematics, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Department of Computer Science, BINUS Graduate Program-Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Rojali, Department of Mathematics, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Gaol, F.L., Department of Computer Science, BINUS Graduate Program-Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Abdurahman, E., Department of Computer Science, BINUS Graduate Program-Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Soewito, B., Department of Computer Science, BINUS Graduate Program-Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The fundamental objectives of image steganography algorithm are to simultaneously achieve high payload or embedding capacity, good visual imperceptibility and security. This paper presents a new approach to improve the embedding capacity and provide an imperceptible visual quality, a novel steganography method based on algorithm twenty five pixel value differencing and modified interval table (TFPVD). The cover image is made into 5x5 blocks that don't overlap and TFPVD method with modified interval is used to embed and extract secret information. The results showed that the proposed TFPVD steganography algorithm has a higher steganographic capacity, which is 1,764 times that of the PBVD algorithm. © 2019 Rojali, Ford Lumban Gaol, Edi Abdurahman and Benfano Soewito.
Author Keywords: Imperceptibility; Pixel value differencing; Steganography; TFPVD
Funding Text 1: This research is supported by Doctoral of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University.

Abstract: This paper presents a new approach to improve the embedding capacity and provide an imperceptible visual quality, a novel steganography method based on twenty five pixel value differencing and modified interval table. The cover image is divided into 5 × 5 non-overlapping blocks and PVD method with modified interval is used to embed and extract secret information. The experimental results show that the proposed method has a higher embedding capacity and good imperceptibility where value PNSR is above 30 dB. © 2019 ICIC International

Title: Resource-Constrained Project Scheduling Problem using Firefly Algorithm
Affiliations: Mathematics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kassandra, T., Mathematics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rojali, Mathematics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suhartono, D., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This research discusses house construction project scheduling which is classified as resource-constrained project scheduling problem with fuzzy trapezoidal number expressing optimistic and pessimistic view of activity duration. Parallel schedule generation scheme is used to generate feasible scheduling solutions, while firefly algorithm is used to find optimal solution by updating priority value of each activity. A web-based application is developed to run the scheduling simulation. Scheduling simulation is conducted to determine the optimal parameter values for firefly algorithm and minimum project makespan. The optimal firefly algorithm parameter values are 10 for light absorption coefficient value, 10 for firefly population, 100 for maximal iteration, and 0.8 for random parameter. With 6 structure resources and 12 finishing resources available for construction project, the minimum project makespan value is [110, 142, 167, 224] with fuzzy magnitude value of 213.583. © 2018 The Authors. Published by Elsevier Ltd.
Author Keywords: firefly algorithm; fuzzy trapezoidal; parallel scheduling generation scheme; resource-constrained project scheduling; scheduling
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Bioluminescence; Constrained optimization; Iterative methods; Light absorption; Parameter estimation; Firefly algorithms; fuzzy trapezoidal; Light absorption coefficients; Parallel scheduling; Resource constrained project scheduling; Resource-constrained project scheduling problem; Scheduling simulation; Web-based applications; Scheduling

Title: Website-based PNG image steganography using the modified Vigenere Cipher, least significant bit, and dictionary based compression methods
Affiliations: Department of Mathematics, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Rojali, Department of Mathematics, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Salman, A.G., Department of Mathematics, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; George, G., Department of Mathematics, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: Along with the development of information technology in meeting the needs, various adverse actions and difficult to avoid are emerging. One of such action is data theft. Therefore, this study will discuss about cryptography and steganography that aims to overcome these problems. This study will use the Modification Vigenere Cipher, Least Significant Bit and Dictionary Based Compression methods. To determine the performance of study, Peak Signal to Noise Ratio (PSNR) method is used to measure objectively and Mean Opinion Score (MOS) method is used to measure subjectively, also, the performance of this study will be compared to other method such as Spread Spectrum and Pixel Value differencing. After comparing, it can be concluded that this study can provide better performance when compared to other methods (Spread Spectrum and Pixel Value Differencing) and has a range of MSE values (0.0191622-0.05275) and PSNR (60.909 to 65.306) with a hidden file size of 18 kb and has a MOS value range (4.214 to 4.722) or image quality that is approaching very good. © 2017 Author(s).
Author Keywords: Cryptography; Dictionary Based Compression; Least Significant Bit; Modified Vigenere Cipher; Pixel Value Differencing; Spread Spectrum; Steganography

Title: Improvement of Advanced Encryption Standard Algorithm with Shift Row and S.Box Modification Mapping in Mix Column
Affiliations: Mathmematics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara Univesity, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara Univesity, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Riyaldhi, R., Mathmematics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara Univesity, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rojali, Mathmematics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara Univesity, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kurniawan, A., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara Univesity, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Cyber Security has become rising issue in recent years where encryption is one of solution and has an important role in data protection. Encryption algorithms that widely used in information security are asymmetric and symmetric. Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) is one of symmetric encryption that most used often and the most secure encryption today. However, AES encryption has slow computation. Our experiment show that both of algorithms combination needs 3.045 milliseconds for 1024 bytes of data and increase 3-4 milliseconds for 2048 bytes of data and so on. This paper proposes a novelty method to improve AES algorithm with Shift Row and S.Box modification for Mix Column transformation. The result show that our optimization has reduced 3 milliseconds and continue to increase as the number of bytes increases. Percentage average of the optimization is 86.143%. © 2017 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: Advanced Encryption Standard; Array Shiftrow; Optimization
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Data privacy; Optimization; Security of data; Advanced Encryption Standard; Advanced Encryption Standard algorithms; AES algorithms; AES encryption; Array Shiftrow; Cyber security; Encryption algorithms; Symmetric encryption; Cryptography

Title: Stepwise Optimization for Model of Integrated Batch Production and Maintenance Scheduling for Single Item Processed on Flow Shop with Two Machines in JIT Environment
Affiliations: Mathematics Department, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Syahdan Street 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Faculty of Engineering, Jendral Ahmad Yani University (UNJANI), Gatot Subroto Street, Bandung, 40285, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Zahedi, Mathematics Department, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Syahdan Street 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rojali, Mathematics Department, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Syahdan Street 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Yusriski, R., Faculty of Engineering, Jendral Ahmad Yani University (UNJANI), Gatot Subroto Street, Bandung, 40285, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper elaborates an integrated model of batch production scheduling and maintenance scheduling on flow shop with two machines producing single item to be delivered at a common due date. The objective function of the model is to minimize total cost consisting of in process and completed part inventory costs, setup costs, preventive and corrective maintenance costs and rework cost on two machines. The Model was a mixed integer quadratic that contains some integer and binary variables, so that analytic search solution could not be used for the model. It was developed a stepwise optimization method to solve the model. This model describes the trade-off between production cost and maintenance cost as the increasing of production run length on two machines. An example is given to clarify how the model solved. © 2017 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: batch production; machine maintenance; stepwise optimization; two machines flow shop
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Costs; Economic and social effects; Machine shop practice; Preventive maintenance; Production control; Scheduling; Scheduling algorithms; Batch production; Flow-shops; Integrated modeling; Machine maintenance; Maintenance scheduling; Objective functions; Preventive and corrective maintenance; Stepwise optimization; Maintenance

Title: Reversible Data Hiding Technique on Jpeg Image by Quad-Tree Segmentation and Histogram Shifting Method Based on Android
Affiliations: Mathmematics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara Univesity, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Program, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara Univesity, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Rojali, Mathmematics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara Univesity, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Salman, A.G., Computer Science Program, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara Univesity, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This research apply data hiding technique in reversible manner into Android application by means of Histogram Shifting with addition maximum and minimum point so that it expected to be capable of hiding high capacity data. The extracted image can use again Histogram Shifting reversibel Algorithm. After process of embedding secret data the resultant distorsion is relative low. Combining is carried on by scheme of hierarchically segmentation (Quad-tree Segmentation) which able to hierarchically partition input of the main image into several size of block based on various pixel under value of maximal capacity criterion for every block that is partitioned. These blocks is organized to be a tree structure for every block that is represented. Moreover the secret data and the partition tree information is embeded in blocks of the image where everey blocks are not squeezed. Using the methods which will be implemented to the coloured image it is expected the capacity of data insertion will increase significantly. © 2015 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
Index Keywords: Android (operating system); Artificial intelligence; Graphic methods; Image segmentation; Steganography; android; Android applications; Capacity criterion; Histogram shifting; Quad trees; Reversible data hiding; Size of blocks; Tree structures; Trees (mathematics)

Title: Steganography using pixel value differencing spiral
Source title: Journal of Theoretical and Applied Information Technology
Affiliations: Dept. of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jalan KH.Syahdan No. 9 Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Salman, A.G., Dept. of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jalan KH.Syahdan No. 9 Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rojali, Dept. of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jalan KH.Syahdan No. 9 Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Vivi, Dept. of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jalan KH.Syahdan No. 9 Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The Further progessive technology make information exchange can be easily accessed by the unauthorized person. Threrefore the method of steganography is made for hiding information in some medium in such a way that the medium seemingly is not contained a piece of information when it seen by human eyes. One of the steganography methods is Pixel Value Differencing (PVD). PVD is inserting message byte into the difference in bytes of the applied medium. This steganography use the modified PVD with some modification. The modification will be carried out on the pixel pick up pattern using spiral pattern to form pixel pair. It will make the message extraction become more difficult. Based on Peak Signal to Noise Ratio(PSNR) and Mean Square Error (MSE) calculation, The results of this study and survey show that using method of Spiral PVD, the quality of the produced image is relatively good.The image before and after message insertion process has relatively same quality. It is clearly evident in the image of “Ungu Cahaya” based on survey as well as MSE and PSNR calculation is proved that it has good quality after message insertion. © 2005 - 2015 JATIT & LLS. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Pixel pick up pattern; Pixel value differencing (PVD); Steganography methods

Authors: Salman A.G., Rojali, Kanigoro B., Nayoko
Title: Steganography application program using the ID3V2 in the MP3 audio file on mobile phone
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Salman, A.G., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Rojali, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Kanigoro, B., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Nayoko, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The MPEG Layer-III File or MP3 can contain the ID3v2 tag which able to store information not only the song and singer's name but also song lyric and alblum cover figure. The steganography technique on audio generally only make use of the main body of the audio file, but has not ever use the part of the ID3v2 to hide an message. This study an steganography technique which make use of this ID3v2 tag space where message is encrypted using McEliece cryptosystem method which applying the public key in the form of matrix then inserted into the MP3 file applying Before All Frames (BAF) method, whereas the public key is inserted into album cover figure which is stored in the ID3v2 tag. © 2014 Science Publications.
Author Keywords: Before all frames; ID3v2 tag; McEliece cryptosystem; MP3
References: Anitha, P.T., Rajaram, M., Sivanandham, S.N., A hybrid approach for detecting stego content in corporate mail using neural network based simplified-data encryption standard algorithm (2012) Am. Authors: Salman A.G., Kanigoro B., Rojali, Kevin, Santy
Title: Application hiding messages in JPEG images with the method of bit-plane complexity segmentation on android-based mobile devices
Affiliations: BINUS University, Jl K.H Syahdan No.9, Jakarta Barat, Jakarta,11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Salman, A.G., BINUS University, Jl K.H Syahdan No.9, Jakarta Barat, Jakarta,11480, Indonesia; Kanigoro, B., BINUS University, Jl K.H Syahdan No.9, Jakarta Barat, Jakarta,11480, Indonesia; Rojali, BINUS University, Jl K.H Syahdan No.9, Jakarta Barat, Jakarta,11480, Indonesia; Kevin, BINUS University, Jl K.H Syahdan No.9, Jakarta Barat, Jakarta,11480, Indonesia; Santy, BINUS University, Jl K.H Syahdan No.9, Jakarta Barat, Jakarta,11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Communications world is growing rapidly in this all-digital era and the importance of the need for a secure and reliable communication is increasing as response to the criminality problems, such as message interceptor problem. By looking at these requirements, a safer way to communicate, such as Cryptography, has been developed. However, the result of this method is not sufficient, because it still risk from the interception of the sent data, caused by cryptography which only hides the data resulting the packaging to be suspicious and draw attention of the hijackers. Therefore, Steganography then developed in which not only hides the content, but also deceptive hijackers with packaging that is not suspicious. In this paper, we discuss the design of steganography which is applied in mobile devices (e.g. mobile phone) using the BPCS (Bit-Plane Complexity Segmentation) by hiding text message into the media reservoir of JPEG data types images. When using this method the message hiding capacity is larger than any other method, up to 40% of the image container. The simulation result reconstructed images which is measured by an objective assessment parameters, based on the Peak Signal to Noise Ratio PSNR, with efficient value obtained on average is 74.3294 dB which is well worth the image quality. © 2012 Elsevier B.V.
